metadata.Title: CVE-2020-11984 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Apache HTTP server 2.4.32 to 2.4.44 mod_proxy_uwsgi info disclosure and possible RCE

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-11984` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-proxy-uwsgi - 2.0.15-10.2ubuntu2.2
libapache2-mod-ruwsgi - 2.0.15-10.2ubuntu2.2
libapache2-mod-uwsgi - 2.0.15-10.2ubuntu2.2
python-uwsgidecorators - 2.0.15-10.2ubuntu2.2
python3-uwsgidecorators - 2.0.15-10.2ubuntu2.2
uwsgi - 2.0.15-10.2ubuntu2.2
uwsgi-app-integration-plugins - 2.0.15-10.2ubuntu2.2

notes.Note: seth-arnold> libapache2-mod-proxy-uwsgi binary package is in universe mdeslaur> the libapache2-mod-proxy-uwsgi module moved from the uwsgi source package to the apache2 source package in focal+

criterions.comment: uwsgi package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.15-10.2ubuntu2.2').
